info.title: Liverpool held by Bayern as fans protest over ticket prices

twitter.description: Supporters of Liverpool and Bayern Munich cast rivalry aside during their high-octane Champions League clash Tuesday to protest against the rising cost of ticket prices.
twitter.title: Liverpool held by Bayern as fans protest over ticket prices

tags: Liverpool held by Bayern as fans protest over ticket prices - CNN

text.markdown:
# Liverpool held by Bayern as fans protest over ticket prices

By James Masters, CNN

Updated 1347 GMT (2147 HKT) February 21, 2019

Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as
it unfolds.

![Bayern fans protest against ticket prices during the game at
Anfield.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAJAJEAAAAAAP///////wAAACH5BAEAAAIALAAAAAAQAAkAAAIKlI+py+0Po5yUFQA7)

Bayern fans protest against ticket prices during the game at Anfield.

(CNN)Supporters of Liverpool and Bayern Munich cast rivalry aside during their
high-octane Champions League clash Tuesday to protest against the rising cost
of ticket prices.

[Follow @cnnsport](https://twitter.com/cnnsport)

Bayern's supporters unfurled a banner early in the second half of the goalless
draw that read: "Away ticket LFC 48£ FCB 55€".

"Th€ gr€€d knows no £imits! Twenty is plenty."

The gesture was applauded around Anfield by Liverpool supporters.

> Anfield applauding this banner from the away end
[pic.twitter.com/KfScrmWjxC](https://t.co/KfScrmWjxC)

>

> — Miguel Delaney (@MiguelDelaney) [February 19,
2019](https://twitter.com/MiguelDelaney/status/1097967448924532737?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

The "Twenty is plenty" refers to the campaign launched in England by the
Football Supporters' Federation for clubs to cap ticket prices for visiting
supporters at £20.

Earlier this month, the English Premier League announced that its clubs would
continue to cap away tickets at £30 for another three seasons after
introducing the plan for the start of the 2016-2017 campaign.

This is not the first time Bayern's fans have protested against the cost of
ticket prices.

![Bayern fans display a banner as they protest against ticket prices during
the Champions League  match at Anderlecht in
2017.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAJAJEAAAAAAP///////wAAACH5BAEAAAIALAAAAAAQAAkAAAIKlI+py+0Po5yUFQA7)

Bayern fans display a banner as they protest against ticket prices during the
Champions League match at Anderlecht in 2017.

[In 2017](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42070078), Bayern supporters
threw fake money onto the field of play during the Champions League victory at
Belgian side Anderlecht after being charged €100 to watch the tie.

In response, Anderlecht was ordered to partially refund Bayern supporters
after the competition's governing body UEFA ruled ticket prices were
excessive. Bayern was fined by UEFA for the protest.

![Ajax All-access: The
Future](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAJAJEAAAAAAP///////wAAACH5BAEAAAIALAAAAAAQAAkAAAIKlI+py+0Po5yUFQA7)

The German club also staged a protest at [Arsenal in 2015
](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-champions-ars-fcb-protest/bayern-
fans-protest-against-arsenal-ticket-prices-idUKKCN0SE2MQ20151020)during a
Champions League tie.

Liverpool supporters also have been vociferous in their criticism of ticket
prices.

[Around 10,000 walked out in the 77th minute of the Premier League
game](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/06/liverpool-fans-walkout-
thousands-ticket-price-protest) with Sunderland in February 2016 in response
to rising season ticket prices.

[READ: Is it time for Real to say goodbye to
Marcelo?](https://cnn.com/2019/02/18/football/real-madrid-la-liga-legends-
marcelo-reguilon-spt-intl/index.html)

[READ: Zlatan: 'I just go out on the field and
dominate'](https://cnn.com/2019/02/18/football/zlatan-ibrahimovic-mls-la-
galaxy-spt-intl/index.html)

The applause from the Liverpool supporters was as raucous as it got at Anfield
with neither team managing to find a breakthrough.

"It was an intense game for both sides," Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp told
BT Sport. "It is not a game we will remember in 30 years. It's the result we
have and we will work with that."

[Visit CNN.com/Sport for more news, features and
video](https://edition.cnn.com/sport)

Goals were in short supply across the Champions League on Tuesday.

![Barcelona's Lionel Messi endured a frustrating night against
Lyon.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAJAJEAAAAAAP///////wAAACH5BAEAAAIALAAAAAAQAAkAAAIKlI+py+0Po5yUFQA7)

Barcelona's Lionel Messi endured a frustrating night against Lyon.

In the night's other game, Barcelona was held to a goalless draw by French
side Lyon.

It was the first night of Champions League football without a goal since March
15, 2016, when Manchester City was held by Dynamo Kiev and Atletico Madrid
finished goalless against PSV Eindhoven.

  *
